description: From German Prostaglandin. Equivalent to prosta(te) + gland + -in. So called because it was originally believed to be secreted by the prostate.

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) Any of a group of naturally occurring lipids derived from the C20 acid prostanoic acid; they have a number of physiological functions and may be considered to be hormones.
examples: This enzyme generates an inflammatory mediator known as prostaglandin, which triggers pain and other aspects of inflammation.
